definition: to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)
to leave (a message etc)/to retain/to stay/to remain/to keep/to preserve

sentences.english: A re-engineering framework of legacy system based on distributed environment of J2EE partition is given.
sentences.chinese: 給出基於J2EE分佈式環境的遺留系統再工程框架。

sentences.english: Pripyat has since been looted and only images and architecture remain.
sentences.chinese: 普里皮亞季因此被掠奪，只有照片跟建築遺留了下來。

sentences.english: First, the two sides do not have a conflict of fundamental interests or outstanding historical issues.
sentences.chinese: 首先，中歐沒有直接地緣戰略衝突和歷史遺留問題。

sentences.english: Iraq is likely to be the focal point of the Bush legacy.
sentences.chinese: 伊拉克很可能是布什所遺留下的一個焦點。

sentences.english: The projects are a mixture of legacy and new code.
sentences.chinese: 這些項目混雜着遺留代碼和新寫代碼。

sentences.english: While succinct, the above interface leaves a lot of questions unanswered.
sentences.chinese: 上面這個接口雖然簡潔，但遺留了許多問題沒有回答。

sentences.english: Is there a defined strategy for the sunset of legacy applications or functions?
sentences.chinese: 是否存在針對遺留應用程序或功能子集的既定策略？

sentences.english: His vest has been left in the hall.
sentences.chinese: 他的汗衫遺留在了門廳。

sentences.english: In Key West, I can just find a trace of his legendary life.
sentences.chinese: 海明威傳奇的一生幾乎在這裏都可以找到遺留的痕跡。

sentences.english: Waste vegetable oil collection box with a few plastic bottles of waste oil left by customers.
sentences.chinese: 廢食用油收集箱與幾個塑料瓶廢油遺留下來的客戶。

sentences.english: She has left, for instance, some troublesome bits of scaffolding, like the vermiform appendix, behind.
sentences.chinese: 比如，它遺留下了令人煩惱的殘留物，如隱藏的闌尾。

sentences.english: We descendants of these animals were left with vestiges of their history, including the hiccup.
sentences.chinese: 我們人類同樣也遺留下這些痕跡，包括打嗝。

sentences.english: We have solved border issues with 12 neighboring countries sharing land border with us.
sentences.chinese: 中國同12個陸地鄰國解決了歷史遺留的邊界問題。

sentences.english: I have only in the after-school time to resolve the problems left in the class.
sentences.chinese: 我只有在課後去研究課上遺留下來的種種問題。

sentences.english: The company wants to embark on a legacy transformation initiative.
sentences.chinese: 該公司希望着手進行遺留系統轉換活動。

definition: to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)
to cause damage to/to ruin/to destroy
it can clearly be seen (that this is the case)/it is (thus) clear/clear/visible
to inherit/to succeed to (the throne etc)/to carry on (a tradition etc)
